xmp_type.name: colorant
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant_description=A structure containing the characteristics of a colorant (swatch) used in a document.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant_label=Colorant

xmp_field.name: swatchName
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/swatchName_description=Name of the swatch.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/swatchName_label=Swatch Name

xmp_field.name: mode
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/mode_description=The color space in which the color is defined.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/mode_label=Mode

xmp_field.name: type
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/type_description=The type of color.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/type_label=Type

xmp_field.name: cyan
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/cyan_description=Cyan value when the mode is CMYK.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/cyan_label=Cyan

xmp_field.name: magenta
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/magenta_description=Magenta value when the mode is CMYK.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/magenta_label=Magenta

xmp_field.name: yellow
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/yellow_description=Yellow value when the mode is CMYK.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/yellow_label=Yellow

xmp_field.name: black
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/black_description=Black value when the mode is CMYK.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/black_label=Black

xmp_field.name: red
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/red_description=Red value when the mode is RGB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/red_label=Red

xmp_field.name: green
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/green_description=Green value when the mode is RGB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/green_label=Green

xmp_field.name: blue
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/blue_description=Blue value when the mode is RGB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/blue_label=Blue

xmp_field.name: L
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/L_description=L value when the mode is LAB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/L_label=L

xmp_field.name: A
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/A_description=A value when the mode is LAB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/A_label=A

xmp_field.name: B
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/B_description=B value when the mode is LAB.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpG/colorant/B_label=B

xmp_type.name: date
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/date_description=A date-time value which is represented using a subset of ISO RFC 8601 formatting, as described in YYYY MM = two-digit month (01=January) NOTE: The use of local times, using a time zone designator of +hh:mm or -hh:mm instead of Z, is recommended to promote human understanding. For example, if you know a file was saved at noon on October 23 a timestamp of 2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00is understandable, while 2004-10-23T18:00:00Zis confusing.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/date_label=Date

xmp_type.name: dimensions
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/stDim/dimensions_description=A structure containing dimensions for a drawn object. Property Value Types
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/stDim/dimensions_label=Dimensions

xmp_type.name: font
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font_description=A structure containing the characteristics of a font used in a document.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font_label=Font

xmp_field.name: fontName
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontName_description=Postscript name of the font.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontName_label=Font Name

xmp_field.name: fontFamily
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFamily_description=The font family name.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFamily_label=Font Family

xmp_field.name: fontFace
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFace_description=The font face name.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFace_label=Font Face

xmp_field.name: fontType
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontType_description=The font type, such as TrueType, Type 1, Open Type, and so on.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontType_label=Font Type

xmp_field.name: versionString
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/versionString_description=The version string: /version for Type1 fonts nameId 5 for Apple True Type and OpenType /CIDFontVersion for CID fonts The empty string for bitmap fonts NOTE: CoolType allows two fonts with the same Postscript name and different technologies to be used at the same time, but not if they are from different versions. So even without this data for a given document you will have unique font data. However, the version can tell you if the font has changed metrics, glyph forms or other important information. This is useful for comparing fonts in two documents or fonts in a document to those in your systeml.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/versionString_label=Version String

xmp_field.name: composite
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/composite_description=When true, this is a composite font.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/composite_label=Composite

xmp_field.name: fontFileName
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFileName_description=The font file name (not a complete path).
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/fontFileName_label=Font File Name

xmp_field.name: childFontFiles
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/childFontFiles_description=The list of file names for the fonts that make up a composite font.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/stFnt/font/childFontFiles_label=Child Font Files

xmp_type.name: locale
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/locale_description=A closed choice that identifies a language, with values from RFC 3066.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/locale_label=Locale

xmp_type.name: mimetype
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/mimetype_description=A text value that identifies the file format. MIME types are defined in RFC 2046.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/mimetype_label=MIME Type

xmp_type.name: propername
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/propername_description=A name of a person or organization, represented as a Unicode text string.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/propername_label=Proper Name

xmp_type.name: uri
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/uri_description=An Internet Uniform Resource Identifier:a compact string of characters for identifying an abstract or physical resource. See
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/uri_label=Uri

xmp_field.name: height
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/height_description=Height in pixels.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/height_label=Height

xmp_field.name: width
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/width_description=Width in pixels.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/width_label=Width

xmp_field.name: format
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/format_description=The image encoding. Defined value.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/format_label=Format

xmp_field.name: image
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/image_description=The thumbnail image (pixel data only) converted to base 64 notation (according to section 6.8 of RFC 2045).
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xapGImg/thumbnail/image_label=Image

xmp_type.name: xpath
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xpath_description=XML Path Language (XPath), for addressing parts of an XML document; see September 2005 Property Value Types.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xpath_label=XPath

xmp_type.name: rational
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/rational_description=To represent EXIF rational values in XMP, they must be converted to text. The recommended approach is to use a value of type September 2005 Property Value Types.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/rational_label=Rational

xmp_type.name: gpscoordinate
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/gpscoordinate_description=A Leading zeros are not necesary for the for DDD, MM, and SS values. The DDD,MM.mmkform should be used when any of the native EXIF component rational values has a denonimator other than 1. There can be any number of fractional digits. Property Value Types.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/gpscoordinate_label=GPS Coordinate

xmp_type.name: langalt
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/langalt_description=A language alternative, which is an array of type alt Text, an alternative array of text items each of which has a language qualifier.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/langalt_label=Language Alternative

xmp_type.name: agentname
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/agentname_description=The name of a program. The suggested convention is "vendor app version"---for example "Adobe Acrobat Distiller 5.0".
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/agentname_label=Agent Name
